techmeme.title: Nvidia starts making its Blackwell chips at TSMC's Phoenix plant and says it aims to make up to $500B of AI infrastructure in the US in the next four years (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Google details DolphinGemma, a new 400M-parameter LLM to decode dolphin communication by analyzing the vocalizations of wild Atlantic spotted dolphins (The Keyword)
Intel says it will sell a 51% stake in Altera to Silver Lake, valuing the programmable chip unit at $8.7B; Intel bought Altera for $15B in 2015 (Zaheer Kachwala/Reuters)
NATO says it will start using Palantir's Maven Smart System, which uses AI to provide "commanders with a secure, common operational capability" (Financial Times)
African Private Capital Association: VC inflows to Africa fell 22% YoY to $3.6B in 2024, after a 31% YoY drop in 2023; fintechs had 116 deals raising $1.4B (Ruth Olurounbi/Bloomberg)
